body.name: HP 650 Wireless Keyboard & Mouse Combo - 2.4Ghz Wireless, USB Receiver, Low-Profile Keys, 20+ Programmable Keys, DPI Mouse - 20+ Months Keyboard, 24+ Mouse Battery - Win, Chrome, MacOS (4R013AA#ABL)
body.merchantInfo: Sold by TRENDY-TECH (We Record Serial Numbers) and Fulfilled by Amazon. Seller Certifications:Minority-Owned Business
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery February 15 - 16. Order within 12 hrs 11 mins.
features: STYLISH and COMFORTABLE – Ergonomically designed wireless keyboard includes adjustable legs and contoured keycaps for comfortable, accurate typing at the perfect angle; plus, the USB wireless mouse’s contoured design delivers comfort for both right and left-handed users
WIRELESS FREEDOM – Eliminate cord clutter with a single 2.4GHz wireless connection for both keyboard and mouse and enjoy compatibility with Windows, macOS, or Chrome devices

CUSTOMIZE TO OPTIMIZE – Customize 20plus programmable keys for reduced keystrokes in your most used apps with the HP Accessory Center (1) and fine tune mouse DPI settings, including cursor speed and sensitivity for greater accuracy
FREE YOUR MOUSE – Power-efficient multi-surface sensor technology delivers smooth, lag-free mouse tracking on virtually any surface, including marble (2)
RELIABLE POWER – Maximize productivity with reduce battery changes with 20plus months of battery life for the keyboard and 24plus months for the mouse (3) using just 2 AAA batteries
RESPONSIBLY MADE – More than 60% of the plastics used in this wireless keyboard and mouse combo come from post-consumer recycled materials (4), which helps reduce landfill waste
body.description: Get everything you want in a wireless keyboard and mouse with the HP 650 Wireless Keyboard and Mouse Combo. Eliminate cord clutter with a single 2.4GHz wireless connection for both keyboard and mouse and enjoy compatibility with Windows, macOS, or Chrome devices. Experience quieter computing without noisy clicks and keystrokes with this low-profile keyboard with numeric keypad and mouse while enjoying 2.4GHz wireless connectivity (1) using a single USB-A receiver. Easily customize 20+ programmable keys on this keyboard using the HP Accessory Center (1) to work smarter with fewer keystrokes, plus customize your wireless mouse settings to your preferred cursor speed and sensitivity. Work just about anywhere with multi-surface technology that delivers reliable mouse tracking on most surfaces (2), even marble, plus the improved optical sensor gives you precise, accurate control of every click and selection for greater speed and efficiency. Energy efficient, the HP 650 Wireless Mouse and Keyboard Combo lets you stay productive all-day without interruption with 20+ months of battery life for the keyboard and 24+ months for the mouse using just 2 AAA batteries (2). (1) Requires HP Accessory Center (HPAC) Software. HPAC available for free download in Microsoft Store or Apple Store. (2) Does not track on glass. (3) Utilizes 2 AAA Batteries. Battery life based on 5 days week, 8 hours per day. Actual battery life will vary with use and environmental conditions and will naturally decrease with time and usage. (4) Recycled plastic content percentage is based on the definition set in the IEEE 1680.1-2018 EPEAT standard. Keyboard contains 62% PCR. (5) Select household wipes can be safely used to clean HP 650 Wireless Keyboard & Mouse Combo up to 1,000 wipes: See wipe manufacturer’s instructions for disinfecting and the HP cleaning guide for HP-tested wipe solutions

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great product, don't know why others said it was no good. I Love it.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this keyboard and mouse to de clutter my desk at work. It works great. No lag. Keyboard is just like the wired one. One thing I love about it and use everyday is the lock button. 🔐 One push and it locks you computer and goes to the lock screen for when I leave my desk. Love it!!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: When reviewers stated that this was a quiet keyboard and there was no lag-time - decided to give it a try. I have a complete HP suite now and they all work fabulously together. Quiet, fast, and no lag time just as advertised and reviewed. The system is also faster as the system does not seem to be fighting to connect all the time. Best of all, the Windows applications all work as designed - right click, drag and drop, keyboard shortcuts, numbers lock, etc., they all work. Thanks to all of you that came before me and wrote the types of meaningful reviews a buyer could use.

reviews.reviewerName: Luis Miguel Ayala RamosLuis Miguel Ayala Ramos
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the price
reviews.reviewText: I used the wired model of this keyboard, and was looking for the wireless version for transitioning between working from home and going back to the office, but without having to learn new muscle memory by buying a different keyboard model altogether. Shipping was speedy to PR. Set up to my HP laptop for both keyboard and mouse was straightforward. The keys are quiet so co workers nearby are not bothered by typing noise, yet the keys feel smooth and are satisfying to press. Definitely enjoying the wireless capability as it eliminates cable clutter at my desk. Definitely worth it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It is a great keyboard for anyone who likes the slim keyboards. My coworker loves it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Easy to set up, has just 1 USB connector for both. Works great

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars typing skips and stops for 4-5 seconds, keys stick down
reviews.reviewText: I've only had the keyboard and mouse set for a couple of months, return window passed. These are in fact made in China, even though HP has tried to move out of there. It shows. Both KB and M stop working for 4-5 sec at a time about every 2 minutes. They seem to be doing a hard reset of the IRQ because when it happens, I can hear a tap sound in the speakers. Swapping to an older setup stopped this. I guess I'm not getting rid of wires, the tech isn't good enough, not when it's made in China anyway.Other problems, there's no way to put down or pick up the keyboard without pressing the keys, so I invariably activate the emoji button or the microphone, or the screenshot.... or lock the screen. Why does a full size keyboard need to be also compact? That's just crazy design. It should be comfortable. HP failed the obvious flaw test this time. Even if they only saw a picture of the design it should've been clearly flawed.You have to hold Fn to then press any F key, so it's Fn-F12 if you want to get into the boot options for example. Which is pretty nutty. Cool that it works wirelessly at all, but try typing that at the correct moment quickly.It's super slow, I have to slow my touch typing or it just stops accepting input for around 5 seconds. Other times I have to find the key that's stuck down whiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiile it types a long line like that. Then there ar the skipped letters like that. Happens a lot, about 30 times a day.I kept thinking it was Windows 11 or wireless, or there was some fix. There's no fix. This KBM set is just bad. A reboot fixes it for about an hour then it's back to bad behavior. Pure junk, do not buy it. Clearly marked Made in China on the back of the Keyboard and I can't find any maker's mark on the mouse at all.HP should pull every one of these off the market. And offer a recall for those who tried to find a fix and let their refund period expire. Total junk.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars mouse works on any surface.
reviews.reviewText: I had a keypad like this that came with one of my monitors.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works with Linux
reviews.reviewText: I am running Ubuntu 20.04 with KDE Plasma and the HP 650 Wireless Mouse and Keyboard Black worked right out of the box as soon as I plugged in the dongle and turned them on. No compatibility issues what so over. I took away one star. The Mic mute key is right above the backspace button and is the exact same size and in the same position. Because of how its designed I hit the mic mute instead of backspace kind of often and it is annoying.
